Detailed Description

BinData defines an interface to access binary data in a way that releases the user from memory management. Usually an instance is created from some class but handled and obtained from another class. Therefor instances should not be constructed directly using a constructor. Any derived classes must provide a static method to create an instance, i.e static BinData* CreateInstance();. A instance must be destructed by invoking the ReleaseInstance(...) method.

Member Function Documentation

BinData * BinData::Clone (   )  const [virtual]
 

Clones the BinData object. Cloning is useful if a BinData object is already obtained by one object, but another object wants to access the same data too. The cloned BinData object must be released by BinData::ReleaseInstance if it is not needed anymore. 0 is returned if the cloning has failed.

Reimplemented in FileBinData, BufferedData, and RamData.

const DrmAsset& BinData::GetDrmAsset (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the DRM asset to process and validate DRM constraints and permissions.

virtual UINT32 BinData::GetLength (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the number of bytes which are hold by this object.

Implemented in FileBinData, ChildBinData, DataSourceBinData, RamData, and RomData.

MemMap* BinData::GetMemMap (  UINT32  idx,
UINT32  size
)  const [inline]
 

Obsolete - use ObtainMemMap instead.

MemMap * BinData::ObtainMemMap (  UINT32  idx,
UINT32  size
)  const [virtual]
 

Obtains a memory map from the given index idx with the specified size size. A size of -1 returns a MemMap to the end of data. 0 is returned if obtaining a memory map is not supported on the bin data object.

Reimplemented in FileBinData, DataSourceBinData, and RamData.

virtual UINT32 BinData::Read (  UINT32  idx,
void *  buf,
UINT32  byte_count
)  const [pure virtual]
 

Reads byte_count bytes starting from the offset idx into buffer buf. Returns the number of read bytes.

Implemented in FileBinData, ChildBinData, DataSourceBinData, RamData, and RomData.

virtual BOOLEAN BinData::Read (  UINT32  idx,
UINT8 &  val
)  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns a single byte in val at the given index idx. val is not changed if idx does not exist.

Returns:
TRUE if a value at the index exists, FALSE otherwise.

Implemented in FileBinData, ChildBinData, DataSourceBinData, RamData, and RomData.

void BinData::ReleaseInstance (   )  [virtual]
 

Releases any allocated resources from BinData and deletes the object.

Reimplemented in BufferedData.

void BinData::ReleaseMemMap (  MemMap **  h_map  )  const [virtual]
 

Releases a MemMap which has been obtained by BinData::ObtainMemMap.

Reimplemented in FileBinData, DataSourceBinData, and RamData.
